commentBody: And equally are they going to give admissions to young women who can be their cheerleaders? Don't admit men for their physical strength alone. Dumbing down the military academies is not in our nation's best interest.

replies.commentBody:
Another example of an academically qualified student sent to NAPS - Emmett Davis - Broadneck High School 2016 honor role student and starting quarterback who like Abey had a great senior season. Next year, he'll be in the academy after attending NAPS which is really for individuals from the Fleet or from an academically poor background to qualify for the Naval Academy.

Also apparently, the Naval Academy has a 185 person football team! That is an incredible number. I doubt any team in the NCAA has that large a squad.

The broader point may be whether NAPS is complying with Title 9 requirements  generally.    My bet is that there is one person at NAPS called "Title 9 Compliance Officer."   Navy has very good male cheer leaders, too.
